Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdgeMY
Reviews.Content: ... but since i not the kind that expects diva treatment wherever i am, let me just say that this is a 1-1.5 star hotel right above a restaurant that is a 5 mins walk to the MRT train station entrance via a mall called Bugis Junction. Plenty of food around the corner, a 24/7 convenience store is 1 minute away. It's an old hotel, BUT it was clean and the room was big enough to my expectation. You get what you pay for. So stay here only if you do not have much of a budget or if you want a budget based hotel in Bugis area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: coneth
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the internet @ $170.00 SGD for a deluxe room. The pictures of the room on the internet do not even come close to the shock that awaits you. The room was basically clean, towels were very thin & had holes (I found myself inspecting them for other surprises) our room was above a Karaoke bar which one night went until 5:00am (was a Monday night ??) and it appeared that somebody with a cold had sneezed over the white bed skirt. The TV worked OK until an electrical appliance was used then the reception was all distorted.The best was the suspended hot water system from the bathroom ceiling - possibly placed there when the Hotel was built.Care factor from staff was zero - & our room was behind the reception desk so we were walking past them every day & they would only acknowledge us in response to our greeting. It was in a great location & it forced us to go out from dawn till dusk as this was not a pleasant place to hang around. I know that you get what you pay for. The internet photos are very misleading & if I had of seen a realistic picture I most certainly would not have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GracyT
Reviews.Content: It's over five years since I last visited Singapore and I was TOTALLY HORRIFIED by the HUGE RISE in the cost of hotel rooms. Granted, all my previous visits have been as a Solo Traveller, stopping off on my way home to the UK after visiting friends in Australia, and my requirements where not as critical as this time. This year I was visiting for just over two weeks with my Fiancee, and wanted us to have as much comfort as I could afford. It took a lot of surfing through agency websites before I found a hotel in Singapore that had a room that didn't stretch my budget too much, and that looked any bigger than a MATCHBOX !!! In fact I got my dates totally mixed up (I added one more day than I should have done to my overnight flight from Manchester, via Doha, and when I tried to check in at Beach Hotel, they looked confused and said they had NO RESERVATION IN MY NAME !!! Only when we compared paperwork did they spot that my Booking Confirmation said 14 nights from Feb 9th ...... and today was Feb 8th !!! They got their doorman to take me to Park View Hotel (just three doors away) and they could provide a room for that night .................. and although a little MORE expensive .......... my Fiancee's first comment as she walked into the room was ..... "Oh, what a TINY ROOM !" Thankfully when we arrived at the FAR LESS IMPRESSIVE LOOKING Beach Hotel the following day, the room we were given, although not as nicely furnished, was nearly TWICE the size of the room at Park View. My Fiancee flew home to The Philippines a couple of days before I left for the UK, and for the last two nights, in order to try to save some money, I moved myself into a Much Cheaper Hotel, where I "enjoyed" THE TINIEST HOTEL ROOM I'VE EVER SEEN !!! Based upon my hunt for the Best Room I could afford, and my later experience, I have to say that for $130 SG a night, I wouldn't be surprised if Beach Hotel offered the BIGGEST & BEST ROOM in City Centre Singapore ! Our room had a Huge Bed (Very comfy too), plenty of space for our luggage and for walking about, a small table, with two chairs, a small wardrobe with a fridge under, and a drawer and storage shelves under the "Dressing Table". We had lots of windows, many which opened and of course Aircon, and a small but adequate Bathroom. There was an electric water heater, so there was ALWAYS hot water available. All the Staff were Very friendly and Helpful, and Especially so the lady who cleaned rooms on our floor. As Bryan H said in his review .... DON'T be put off by the TOTALLY UNIMPRESSIVE Access and Reception Area ! I wonder "what on Earth have I booked us into" when I first arrived !!! This place definitely fits into the expression ... "Don't Judge A Book By It's Cover". Beach Hotel is a very short walk to Bugis Village, Bugis Street Market and Bugis MRT Station and it is surrounded by Shops, Street Cafes and Restaurants. It's a good area and well placed for getting around. I was taken ill just two days after arriving. I damaged my spine in a lifting accident at work 20 years ago, and an awkward pull from my G/F to get me out of bed for Breakfast triggered agonising pain. I used up all the emergency med's I'd brought with me without any improvement and ended up in Raffles Hospital. Which is Another PLUS for Beach Hotel, as the hospital is within walking distance (but not for me as I couldn't walk), and only $5 by taxi. All the staff were very helpful and sympathetic to my condition. Unfortunately my incapacity put paid to most of the Trips and Visits we had planned for our holiday, and we spent a lot more time than we had intended, in our room. So it was a DOUBLE BONUS that our room was SO BIG and COMFORTABLE. My biggest complaints would have to be the AWFUL TV Reception, with only 3 of the 15 or so channels providing a signal that could be watched, and the VERY EXPENSIVE and Unsecure Wi-Fi facility. YES, I would stay there again, and YES I would recommend Beach Hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Bryan H
Reviews.Content: We chose the Beach for its large comfortable rooms after staying in a place with rooms which were too small. It was worth the upgrade (S$85 to $130). I see others have found the service poor but we were treated with friendliness and helpfulness at all times. Don't be put off by the access to the hotel, which is reached via a hidden and rather disreputable-looking street entrance, and the reception area also looks a bit small and cramped. But the rooms are fine. Busy street life outside until late at night but we were not disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “They tried to make a real steal via their terible customer service”
Reviews.Author: niemrieng
Reviews.Content: I was with my family at Beach hotel in November 2011. The location is good however the service was terrible. It was my last day at Singapore, we asked the receptionist to call a taxi for us. And she recommend a taxi with the price of 45 Sing dollar. It was unacceptable, the normal price should be 20-25 Singapore dollars. 45 is too much even if they wanna add their service charge. We politely asked her to call a normal taxi for us and she totally refused and let us go out in the rain. Thanks to local people around for helping us to catch the taxi. I believe that a good customer service never treats their customers like that even if it is our last day at the hotel. Maybe she thinks that we will never come back so it's her last chance for a real "steal" from us. NEVER COME TO THIS HOTEL. that's all I say about Beach hotel. HP

Reviews.Title: “The good the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: vacationerfmsing
Reviews.Content: Good. Fairly centrally located and has all the bits you need Bad. Reception reception staff and bell boys Ugly. Rooms Stayed here during a full week in Singapore. Reception is a joke a bad dream and takes forever to find the reservation, room and the key. Then actually getting shown where the lift is or where to go or get help with your baggage is like a bad trip to the dentist Rooms are basic, clean to a poor standard, seen much better days and dingy dark and the beds are deemed ok only. Not good not the worst but give it a short time and they will be very unpleasant Within many budget I guess but shall not be returning

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Well located”
Reviews.Author: EMKLusaka
Reviews.Content: I spent my days at beach hotel. Staff friendly and rooms clean. It was 130 Singapore Dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: piggiefatso
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were transferring from Malaysia to Korea and just needed a place to stay for 1 night in Singapore. We went to the hotel reservation counter at the airport and the lady recommended this place stating that it was a clean hotel in a great location but that it had no amenities. We got to the hotel and it really was clean and in a great location near many places to eat and metro stops. However, it's above a restaurant and in an area that seemed to be a popular place for people to hang out so it gets a little noisy at night, but nothing that kept me up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location with a busy restaurant downstairs”
Reviews.Author: StartsnendswA
Reviews.Content: The location was very central and the room was basic but clean. However it's not a good hotel for early and/or light sleepers. Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mugo-nubayun
Reviews.Content: Went to Singapore first week of March 2011 to attend a conference in Raffles Hotel. The office was late in confirming our booking for the other hotels and I ended up in this hotel. The taxi driver got lost and he has to call the hotel to ask for its location. Entrance is on the side street and you have to take the elevator to the 2nd floor to get to the lobby. Nothing fancy here as you walk through a corridor to a small reception area. The middle age lady was quite friendly though and the staff were quite helpful in giving us directions and arranging for our taxi when we were about to leave. The room was small and the small LCD only has 2 (or 3?) english channels. Bathroom was basic as well. Wasn't able to try room service and am not sure if they have one in the first place. The nice thing about the hotel is the location. It is about 5-10 minutes walk to the Raffles. There are lot of restaurants and pubs in the area. if you are looking for a decent and inexpensive hotel, this could be it. Other than those reasons, try the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “pretty terrible”
Reviews.Author: Matilda094
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves stuck in Singapore for a night and booked this hotel through the information centre at the airport. We were aware that it was only 3 star, and the woman at the airport said "its okay for a shower and sleep". However, it was worse than we were expecting. Very basic room, basic bedding, basic bathroom.... you get the picture. In addition, the reception staff were very unhelpful, and bordering on plain rude. The porter was very nice though. Okay location. Don't stay, unless like us, you have to!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: giji365
Reviews.Content: A pure budget hotel in Singapore. We took a triple room and was neat. Our requirement was only for a day,as our official booking in Gallery hotel was available only the next day. A very congested hotel complex and the A/C was not powerful enough. The hotel was neat. No complaints for the money at which we got it. Location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff. Expensive for its price. Tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: NKM11
Reviews.Content: Really really small rooms. Located above a smelly restaurant serving all sorts of things. No problems really, just expensive for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel at its best”
Reviews.Author: SriramHariharan
Reviews.Content: Beach hotel at Singapore is one good hotel in the budget category. We booked this hotel after comparing the prices of other budget hotels that we got on asiarooms.com website. The hotel is located very close to Bugis station, which is the center of the city. Its easily approachable from the station and takes 5 mins to reach. The hospitality offered at the hotel is very nice and it gives a great feeling to a tourist visitor. The rooms are very clean and it is worth to stay here. The room rates come to about 120-130 SGD (on normal days). During December, which is the peak season time at Singapore, the rooms are charged at 160 SGD. But definitely after my experience, I feel it is worth paying 160 SGD and having a nice time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just cheap”
Reviews.Author: bebe12
Reviews.Content: On a one night trip to Singapore, I chose to stay at Beach Hotel for its location and price. The entrance of the hotel is on a side street right off Beach Road, where you have to take the lift to the 2nd floor for check in. The lobby is shabby and messy but the counter ladies were friendly enough. I was sceptical about the room after seeing the lobby but it turned out ok. Though the room was old, the bed and bathroom were clean enough. Believe every room allows smoking but I personally did not think the room smelled bad, as many smoking rooms would. There was no breakfast or coffee/tea maker in the room but you can find restaurants aplenty right outside the hotel. S$100 for this hotel would have been too much if not for its location. 5 minutes stroll to Bugis Junction Mall and MRT station, 10 minutes walk to Raffles City, plenty of good restaurants around the area, easy to get taxis at Beach Road. If you are looking for cheap place near city centre, this is acceptable for a night or two. Would recommend to pay a little more and get a better place if you intend to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ramzzzz
Reviews.Content: The Beach hotel is located in the heart of Singapore's business area, well connected by the MRT(Raffles station), taxi and bus service. Dont go there if you are looking for a super luxury hotel or a posh place but other than that it does everything for you. It is relatively cheap, clean, hassle free, decent sized room, cozy beds, okay bathrooms. The two things that I think didnt like were, 1) no coffee/tea in the room and 2) bathroom and linen could be cleaner. The bathroom door was also not closing properly. I think for the price it is a good deal at a super location.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: 4mango1980
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon we ended up in Singapore for two nights unexpectedly because of a missed flight and stayed at the Beach hotel. We chose it because of its location and because it was relatively inexpensive (we paid $100 SD per night). The hotel entrance is on a street corner and you have to take an elevator up to the lobby. The staff were friendly and there was wireless internet and a computer that you can use for a small fee. The room was very basic and pretty small and the shower was kinda feeble. But, it wasn't a bad option considering it was one of the cheapest options in that area of town- it's in a great location near the pier, the Raffles hotel and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: noname96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a good value. The rooms and linen are old and dingy, and smell of cigartettes. They have no non-smoking rooms so if the smell of cigarettes bothers you, don't get a room at this hotel. It was also very hot (middle of August) but the air conditioner in our room did not work. After a very uncomfortable night, we were finally moved in to a different room that had a working air conditioner but a line of ants across the ceiling and a refrigerator that smelled like something died in it. We would have moved to a different hotel but were already committed to this hotel so we decided to just tough it out. The hotel staff were nice enough, except upon our departure. When we picked up our bags to go to the airport, the woman at the reception desk told us the "doorman" would be able to get us a taxi. When we asked him to call us a taxi, he told us to go to the corner with all of our bags and hail a cab ourselves. He did not want to help us. A fitting end to our visit I guess. My advice, pick a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, ok value”
Reviews.Author: Fibb
Reviews.Content: It seems difficult to get a cheap hotel in Singapore that isn't either a filthy dump or located in the red light district. Beach hotel is one of a few decent alternatives in this price range. The hotel has a very good location. The room (superior) and bathroom was ok sized but a bit old. Very clean. Couldn't find any channels on the TV but I really didn't care. I'm not going to Singapore to watch TV! The staff wasn't rude but not exactly friendly either. Sick of their job probably.. There is no breakfast but many nice places to eat just outside the hotel. The price seems a bit high for what you get but that's Singapore... No big complaints but a totally average experience. Quite allright if you're not gonna spend a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it is ok.”
Reviews.Author: Arhza
Reviews.Content: Well, everything is very expensive in this town except the food and electronics. The hotel is ok for a sleep no more, no to relax. The room is smal. A clean bathroom but a little bit old. They have no breafast but there is a lot of restaurants in the same street. The room smell smoke, there have not a no smoking room. The hotel is close to a busstation and to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Rooms..Great location”
Reviews.Author: SharkyReef
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel. Great location. NEarby to SUntec COnvention Centre, MRT and all the city cnetre attractions. The hotel is a little worn down but acceptably clean. SIngapore has a shortage of budget to mid range hotel rooms...therefore you'll have to book at least 3-4 weeks in advance. Will I stay there again, maybe not if I can help it. For the price we paid (S$140 per night for a deluxe room), I think you may be able to get a better place. However, for the whole package, ie. location, convenience, budget, then it's not too bad. NO major complains.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: dreamchaserez
Reviews.Content: Whilst plan for a short stay in Singapore due to function, I checked the hotels and found this hotel via an online search. It was one of the budget ones which is nearby the MRT station and so this was just the right one! Nearby the hotel, there are Bugis Junction shopping mall, Bugis Village and Street which are about 5 min walk away. Nearest MRT station is which is Bugis MRT station is situated inside Bugis Junction shopping mall itself. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel itself, varying from Fastfood, Duck/Chicken rice,etc.Not to mention, there are 7-11 nearby if you need to buy anything. The staffs were pretty friendly. The room that itself is pretty cosy, clean and spacious enough. The bathroom is fairly spacious too and the sheets are clean. The furniture and the carpets is of "age" but were fine, no problems with them. For travellers that need only place to stay and not much indoor facitilities, this hotel is fine to stay in. In short, good location for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “staff problems”
Reviews.Author: knight8
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the hotel, my wife and myself were looked after like we were royalty, we were there for only three nights at the beginning of march 2007, it was the start of our round the world anniversary trip. The PROBLEMS started on the morning of departure when i recieved the final bill i queried a payment for a limo transfer the response i got was i would have to sort it out when i returned to the uk in approx 6-7 weeks after our holiday. I also asked for a limo to take us back to the airport and the reply was i would have to take a taxi, by this time my wife was getting upset about what was going on, so when the taxi arrived he had trouble getting all the luggage in and even had to put 2 cases on the front seat and we were charged 50 dollars for the ride. I also had to pay approx 270 pounds for the privlige of having our room ready for when we arrived at 8-00am otherwise we would have had to wait till 2 o,clock to check in. At the time of check out the staff on the desk and the person who came out of the office who,s name i did not get, did not seem to give a HOOT . I have been in contact with the hotel but to no avail, i am totally disgusted with the check out staff they put a damper on what was a great experiance of staying in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent !”
Reviews.Author: bloodbubble
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Beach Hotel for 2 nights in mid March this year with a friend when we travelled to Singapore. I found the hotel via an online search and it was one of the cheaper ones and I wanted a hotel nearby the MRT station so this was just the right one! Bugis Junction shopping mall and MRT station is barely 5 mins walk from the hotel and restaurants are aplenty once you step out of the hotel so no problem if you ever get hungry. The rooms are cosy, sheets are clean and the bathroom was fairly spacious. Only complain is the tv set in the hotel had only several channels tuned and no cable! Overall, great value for money and great location!
